item.title: Bitcoin Price Crash: Why The Sell-Off?
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Crash: Why The Sell-Off?

The bitcoin price chart slammed down like a Stark on a Bolton, today, but readers are being encouraged to take heart from the healthy correction and well-deserved profit-taking. This is the natural behavior of markets, and after a much need pullback greater things lie ahead for the bitcoin price chart and for Bitcoin at large.

item.title: Expert: The DAO Was Exploited, Not Hacked, Ethereum Should Do Nothing
item.description:
Expert: The DAO Was Exploited, Not Hacked, Ethereum Should Do Nothing

Since the June 17 attack on The DAO, there have been several opinions as to what should be the best action to be taken by the owners of Ethereum. Covertress Covertress, founder of Krypton, offers Cointelegraph her analysis of the attack and its fallout.

item.title: Around July 10, the Bitcoin Supply Will Grow Half as Quickly
item.description:
Around July 10, the Bitcoin Supply Will Grow Half as Quickly

The price of bitcoin has been nuts. If you bought bitcoin in April, you've earned 60 percent. If you bought bitcoin this weekend, you've lost ten percent. As I write this, the price has dipped down back under $700. A few weeks ago, $600 seemed a long way off.

item.title: Finnish City Awarded €2.4 Million to Test Blockchain-Powered Shipping - CoinDesk
item.description:
Finnish City Awarded €2.4 Million to Test Blockchain-Powered Shipping - CoinDesk

An economic development firm owned by the city of Kouvola in Finland has received €2.4m to help pay for a project designed to streamline the supply chain using blockchain. To be dispersed over a three-year period, the money from Kouvola Innovation will be used in part to connect various enterprise resource planning (ERP) tools used by the ...

item.title: Tech Bureau and Infoteria Bring Private Blockchain To Microfinance
item.description:
Tech Bureau and Infoteria Bring Private Blockchain To Microfinance

Blockchain technology is making the rounds in many different sectors all over the world. The world's first experiment of private blockchain technology has been recorded, thanks to Tech Bureau and Infoteria. Recording account data on this blockchain for microfinance purposes has been successful, which is a positive sign for both companies.

item.title: Euroclear Announces New Blockchain-Based Gold Settlement
item.description:
Euroclear Announces New Blockchain-Based Gold Settlement

Euroclear is best known for being one of the world's biggest settlement houses in the financial sector. After taking a close look at blockchain technology, the company announced their first product trial: a new settlement system for the London gold market will be created.

item.title: Notorious Deep Web Seller Fredthebaker Arrested By Dutch Police
item.description:
Notorious Deep Web Seller Fredthebaker Arrested By Dutch Police

Law enforcement officials are cracking down on anybody who sells or buys goods on the deep web these days. Fredthebaker, a notorious deep web seller, has been arrested in The Netherlands. As it turns out, this username is linked to a collective of sellers, and four people have been detained.

item.title: Coinbase Co-Founder Cautions Against Ethereum Hard Fork - CoinDesk
item.description:
Coinbase Co-Founder Cautions Against Ethereum Hard Fork - CoinDesk

Digital currency exchange operator Coinbase is weighing in on the ongoing crisis over The DAO, the distributed autonomous organization (DAO) that recently saw millions in customer funds seized by an unknown individual or individuals through a code exploit.

item.title: Microsoft Hopes For Wider Adoption Of Blockchain With Project Bletchley
item.description:
Microsoft Hopes For Wider Adoption Of Blockchain With Project Bletchley

A few days ago, Microsoft has announced the launch of its Azure-based project Bletchley enabling those interested to use so-called blockchain fabric to create their own blockchain systems of any complexity. The release could catapult Microsoft to a different level of blockchain technology acquisition.

item.title: Bitcoin Evangelist Has Podcast Go Bad, Threatens To Sue After It's Posted | Techdirt
item.description:
Bitcoin Evangelist Has Podcast Go Bad, Threatens To Sue After It's Posted | Techdirt

Folks in the Bitcoin/blockchain world can be fairly opinionated -- that's no surprise. But just because you have an interview go sideways, it doesn't mean you get to threaten a lawsuit over it. That's not how it works. Perianne Boring founded and runs a lobbying organization focused on Bitcoin/blockchain issues called the Chamber of Digital Commerce.
